subject: Photography
title: Copyright and Image Ownership
description: A quick win: understand Copyright and Image Ownership.

hook.text: You take a photo. Someone uses it without permission. Who owns the image? Copyright law says you do ‚Äî usually.

buildup.text: In most countries, the photographer automatically owns the copyright to images they create, with some exceptions.

discovery.text: Work-for-hire, employee agreements, and some contract terms can transfer ownership to clients or employers.

twist.text: The internet made copying effortless. Enforcing copyright online is expensive, slow, and often futile.

climax.text: AI image generators trained on copyrighted photos raised new questions: who owns an image created by a machine?

punchline.text: Creating is easy. Protecting what you create is the hard part.

quiz.question: What new copyright challenge has AI created for photography?
options: Questions about who owns images generated by AI trained on copyrighted work
